intro: Neonauclea macrostipula, commonly known as the large-stippled neonauclea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with prominent stipules and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
